attributes.comment:
We are currently in the waiting process of an adoption from China and have
learned about the proposed rate increase and would like to comment. An
adoption is an expensive affair and adoptions from China are an incredibly long
process. Right now, it appears we will have to re-do our I171H because the wait
time is going to exceed the validity of the I171H we already have. That means
that there is more money we have to put out that could otherwise be spent on
raising our new daughter...and now it may cost us more? It is not as though we
do not appreciate the work that your agency does to aid us in bringing our new
daughter home to the United States, but we are concerned of the costs involved.
If a rate increase meant perhaps a longer validity of the I171H, then perhaps it
would be worth it. This journey for us is long, hard and expensive, but the reward
is priceless. We would appreciate it if you would consider not raising the rates.
We thank you for the opportunity to express our thoughts.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Heather M. Freeman
